title: Self-Raised; Or, From the Depths
author: Southworth, Emma Dorothy Eliza Nevitte
snippet: In a few moments Detective Ogilvie waited on Lady Vincent, andreceived her statement in regard to the robbery, promised to takeprompt measures for the discovery of the thief, and retired.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: Thus it happened oddly enough, that Keith, who was abroad during the transaction,  and had nothing to do with it, got the earldom, pension, &c, Ogilvie only inferior honours, and the poor clergyman nothing whatever, or, as we say, the hare's foot to lick.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Ogilvie, for all the loss of property and longimprisonment Avhich Avere his share of the adventure, got only abaronetcy and a neAv coat-of-arms.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: " Now, what's the use of all this struggling, as you call it,Ogilvie?" said Macintyre, who was a pessimist of the mostconfirmed type, as many young men are at his time of life.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: " Humph, Ogilvie, cracking up the Bar again; you alwayslook at the roseate side of things," said Macintyre gloomily.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: The Regent, thelord James, having been shot at Linlithgow, and no man asyet appointed to replace him, whiles all the noblemen of note,Argyle, Huntly, Athole, Errol, Eglinton and Ogilvie, and a hostbehind them, being strong for the restoration of the queen, wewere in hopes that gif we adventured home we would be safe.
